title: Middle school principal in Maine draws criticism after dressing as ICE agent for Halloween
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: James Black, principal of Mt. Blue Middle School in Farmington, Maine, criticized for wearing ICE agent costume on Halloween.
Superintendent Christian Elkington confirmed the incident took place off school grounds and is handling it per district procedures.
Project Relief Maine condemned the outfit, stating it instilled fear among immigrant students, calling it inappropriate and traumatic.

title: What Christian Gonzalez said about his head injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez was cleared of concussion after his head injury in the Patriots' game against the Falcons.
The injury occurred during a play involving a 40-yard catch by Atlanta's Drake London in the fourth quarter.
New England Patriots secured a narrow victory over Atlanta, thanks to a missed extra point by the Falcons.

title: South End residents say they picked up 180 needles in less than a week at neighborhood park
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: South End volunteers collected 180 needles in six days around Southwest Corridor Park, raising community safety concerns.
City Councilor Ed Flynn stresses zero tolerance for open drug use and dealing, advocates more resources for needle pick-up.
Boston Public Health distributes 81,000 needles monthly; Flynn considers the number excessive and urges significant reduction.

title: What Kevin Durant said about Jayson Tatum’s Achilles recovery, chances of returning this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kevin Durant noted Jayson Tatum is ahead of schedule in his Achilles recovery, already dunking six months post-injury.
Durant praised Tatum's rehab progress, highlighting the advanced medical treatments available today compared to Durant's own recovery.
Tatum is considering a return this NBA season, with Durant emphasizing his love for playing regardless of team record.

title: Amid tragedy, childhood friends DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings persevere in Patriots’ win
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings played standout games in the Patriots' 24-23 win over the Falcons.
Both players, childhood friends from Jacksonville, performed despite learning of a close family friend's death.
Douglas recorded 100 receiving yards and a touchdown; Jennings scored his first NFL touchdown with 35 yards rushing.

title: Mike Vrabel shares message to Patriots, Drake Maye after nail-biting win over Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots secured a narrow 24-23 win over the Atlanta Falcons at Gillette Stadium.
Despite committing two turnovers, quarterback Drake Maye passed for 259 yards and two touchdowns against a tough Falcons defense.
Coach Mike Vrabel encouraged the team to focus on joy and resilience after the hard-fought victory.

title: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren dies ‘unexpectedly’ at 55
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren died unexpectedly at home in Newton at age 55, cause of death unannounced.
Warren was the first African American elected mayor in Massachusetts, serving Newton from 2009 to 2018.
Warren was Director of the Institute of Politics at Harvard and served in Iraq as a Navy Reserve intelligence officer.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against Falcons
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: DeMario Douglas had a standout game with his first career 100-yard performance, including a 58-yard catch.
Drake Maye struggled with turnovers, but delivered key throws despite being sacked six times by the Falcons.
Marcus Jones was exploited by Atlanta, allowing two red-zone touchdowns due to height mismatches with Drake London.

title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A new survey shows a decrease in residents feeling 'less safe' downtown, from 70.6% last year to 33.7% this year.
The Downtown Boston Public Safety Summit addressed issues like drug use and road safety, highlighting reduced violent crime rates.
Retail vacancies downtown are at their lowest since COVID-19, attributed to improved public safety perceptions, according to officials.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ 24-23 win over the Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots extended their win streak to six games with a narrow 24-23 victory over the Falcons at Gillette Stadium.
Drake Maye threw for 259 yards and two touchdowns but committed two turnovers leading to 10 points for Atlanta.
Falcons' kicker Parker Romo missed a crucial extra point, allowing the Patriots to secure the win without overtime.
